summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2017 (NA) ARISING CARGO TRAILER ATTACHED TO A 2006 GMC SIERRA 1500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE BRAKES ON THE TRAILER WERE NOT WIRED PROPERLY. THE DEALER (COLONY CARGO LLC, 681 BENJAMIN H HILL DR, W, FITZGERALD, GA 31750) ADVISED THE CONTACT TO CALL THE MANUFACTURER. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED AND INFORMED THE CONTACT TO BRING THE TRAILER IN FOR DIAGNOSTIC TESTING. THE TRAILER WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE VIN WAS UNKNOWN. THERE WAS NO MILEAGE.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2017 (NA) ARISING 716VTRW ENCLOSED TRAILER. WHILE HAULING THE TRAILER AT 50 MPH, THE FRONT AXLE BECAME EXTREMELY HOT. THE TRAILER WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC WHO DIAGNOSED THAT THE BRAKE WIRING WAS POORLY ASSEMBLED AND THE CONNECTORS USED WERE INCORRECT. THE REAR AXLE BRAKES ALSO FAILED AND IT WAS DIAGNOSED THAT THE WIRES RUNNING TO THE REAR AXLE WERE DISCONNECTED. THE TRAILER WAS REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT SPOKE TO THE DEALER THAT SOLD HIM THE TRAILER AND WAS ADVISED TO SPEAK TO THE MANUFACTURER. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 40.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2013 ARISING CARGO TRAILER. THE CONTACT STATED THAT HE WAS PERFORMING A GENERAL INSPECTION ON THE VEHICLE, AND NOTICED THAT A PART OF THE FRONT HITCH NEAR THE AXLE WAS  MISSING PARTS OF THE FRAME. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR INSPECTION AND THEY STATED THAT THE VEHICLE WAS NOT MANUFACTURED CORRECTLY AND THE FRAME NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THERE WAS NO FAILURE MILEAGE FOR THE CARGO TRAILER.
